==Events==
*[[43 BC]] &ndash; [[Cicero|Marcus Tullius Cicero]] is assassinated.
* [[574]] &ndash; Emperor [[Justin II]] retires due to recurring seizures of [[insanity]]. He abdicates the [[throne]] in favor of his general [[Tiberius II Constantine|Tiberius]], proclaiming him ''[[Caesar (title)|Caesar]]''.
*[[1724]] &ndash; [[Tumult of Thorn (Toruń)|Tumult of Thorn]]: Religious unrest is followed by the execution of nine [[Protestantism|Protestant]] citizens and the mayor of [[Toruń|Thorn (Toruń)]] by [[Poland|Polish]] authorities.
*[[1732]] &ndash; The [[Royal Opera House]] opens at [[Covent Garden]], [[London]], [[England]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette]], arranges to enter the [[United States|American]] military as a major general.
*[[1787]] &ndash; [[Delaware]] becomes the first state to ratify the [[United States Constitution]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Prairie Grove]], [[Arkansas]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; American outlaw [[Jesse James]] commits his first confirmed bank robbery in [[Gallatin, Missouri]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[United States]] declares war on [[Austria-Hungary]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[W1WX|W1XAV]] in [[Boston|Boston, Massachusetts]] telecasts video from the [[CBS]] radio orchestra program, ''The Fox Trappers''. The telecast also includes the first [[Television advertisement|television commercial]] in the [[United States]], an advertisement for I.J. Fox Furriers, who sponsored the radio show.
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Australia]]n [[cricket]]er [[Jack Fingleton]] becomes the first player to score [[century (cricket)|centuries]] in four consecutive [[Test cricket|Test]] innings.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Attack on Pearl Harbor]] &ndash; The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] carries out a surprise attack on the [[United States Pacific Fleet]] and its defending [[United States Army Air Forces|Army]] and Marine air forces at [[Pearl Harbor]], [[Hawaii]]. (For Japan's near-simultaneous attacks on [[Eastern Hemisphere]] targets, see [[December 8]].)
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Winecoff Hotel fire|A fire at the Winecoff Hotel]] in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], kills 119 people, the deadliest hotel fire in U.S. history.
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Chinese Civil War]]: The government of the [[Taiwan|Republic of China]] moves from [[Nanjing|Nanking]] to [[Taipei]], [[Taiwan]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; Prince [[Rainier III, Prince of Monaco|Rainier III]] of [[Monaco]] revises the [[principality]]'s [[Constitution of Monaco|constitution]], devolving some of his power to advisory and legislative councils.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Instant replay]] makes its debut during an American [[Army Black Knights football|Army]]–[[Navy Midshipmen football|Navy]] football game.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Pope Paul VI]] and [[Patriarch Athenagoras I of Constantinople|Patriarch Athenagoras I]] [[Catholic–Orthodox Joint Declaration of 1965|simultaneously revoke]] mutual [[excommunication]]s that had been in place since [[1054]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Imelda Marcos]] survives an assassination attempt using a [[bolo knife]] against her.   
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Pakistan]] President [[Yahya Khan]] announces the formation of a coalition government with [[Nurul Amin]] as Prime Minister and [[Zulfikar Ali Bhutto]] as Deputy Prime Minister.
*[[1972]] &ndash; ''[[Apollo 17]]'', the last [[Apollo program|Apollo moon mission]], is launched. The crew takes the photograph known as ''[[The Blue Marble]]'' as they leave the [[Earth]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Indonesia]] invades [[East Timor]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; In [[Texas]], [[Charles Brooks, Jr.]], becomes the first person to be [[capital punishment|executed]] by [[lethal injection]] in the [[United States]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; An [[Iberia (airline)|Iberia Airlines]] [[Boeing 727]] collides with an [[Aviaco]] [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9|DC-9]] in dense [[fog]] while the two airliners are taxiing down the runway at [[Madrid–Barajas Airport]], killing 93 people.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Pacific Southwest Airlines Flight 1771]] crashes near [[Paso Robles, California]], killing all 43 on board, after a disgruntled passenger shoots his ex-boss traveling on the flight, then shoots both pilots and himself.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[1988 Spitak earthquake|Spitak Earthquake]]: In [[Armenia]] an [[earthquake]] measuring 6.9 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]] kills more than 25,000, injures 30,000 and leaves 500,000 homeless out of a population of 3,500,000.
*  1988   &ndash; [[Yasser Arafat]] recognizes the right of [[Israel]] to exist.
*[[1993]] &ndash; The Long Island Rail Road massacre: Passenger [[Colin Ferguson (mass murderer)|Colin Ferguson]] murders six people and injures 19 others on the [[Long Island Rail Road|LIRR]] in [[Nassau County, New York]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Galileo (spacecraft)|Galileo spacecraft]] arrives at [[Jupiter]], a little more than six years after it was launched by [[Space Shuttle Atlantis]] during [[STS-34|Mission STS-34]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; ''[[A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc., 114 F.Supp.2d 896|A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc.]]'': The [[Recording Industry Association of America]] sues the [[peer-to-peer]] [[file sharing|file-sharing]] service [[Napster]], alleging [[copyright infringement]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Conservative Party of Canada]] is officially registered, following the merger of the [[Canadian Alliance]] and the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Rigoberto Alpizar]], a passenger on American Airlines Flight 924 who allegedly claimed to have a bomb, is shot and killed by a team of U.S. [[Federal Air Marshal Service|federal air marshals]] at [[Miami International Airport]].
*  2005   &ndash; [[Ante Gotovina]], a Croatian army general accused of war crimes, is captured in the [[Playa de las Américas]], [[Tenerife]], by [[Spain|Spanish]] police.
*[[2006]] &ndash; A [[2006 London tornado|tornado]] strikes [[Kensal Green]], North West London, seriously damaging about 150 properties.
*[[2007]] &ndash; The [[2007 South Korea oil spill|''Hebei Spirit'' oil spill]] begins in [[South Korea]] after a crane barge that had broken free from a tug collides with the [[Oil tanker#Size categories|Very Large Crude Carrier]], ''Hebei Spirit''.
